original: When an English speaker realises that a foreign person they are speaking to doesn't understand one of their sentences, they repeat it, the same way, but louder, as though the person were deaf. At no point does it come to their mind that their vocabulary might be complicated or that their expression might most probably be ambiguous to a foreigner and that they could reword it in a simpler way. The result is that not only does the person still not understand, but they get irritated at being considered deaf.
translated: Lorsqu'un anglophone s'aperçoit que son interlocuteur étranger n'a pas compris une de ses phrases, il la répète, à l'identique, mais plus fort, comme si son interlocuteur était sourd. À aucun moment il ne lui vient à l'esprit que son vocabulaire est peut-être compliqué ou que sa formulation est très probablement ambiguë pour un étranger et qu'il pourrait reformuler d'une manière plus simple. Le résultat est que non seulement l'interlocuteur ne comprend toujours pas, mais il est irrité d'être pris pour un sourd.

original: You're the most beautiful girl I've ever seen.

original: I love you like a son.

original: He declined their invitation.

original: I bet you're busy.

original: I think I did it.

original: I'm not ashamed of who I am.

original: Tom was fucking Mary while translating this sentence on his Android device.
translated: Tom baisait Mary tout en traduisant cette phrase sur son terminal Android.

original: We're wealthy.

original: He was born in the 19th century.
translated: Il est né au XIXe siècle.

original: What have you chosen?

original: Ann was long coming.

original: Poor girl! she cried, what can I do for you?

original: You're not finished.

original: Stay there.

original: He's nothing more than a common thug.

original: He arrived in time.

original: I just want to get some sleep.

original: Stop it!

original: The Ferris wheel is my favorite.

original: Put your hat back on.

original: This racket belongs to me.

original: I like beef more than anything.

original: How many does he want?

original: Could you get me some cough drops?
translated: Pourrais-tu aller me chercher du sirop pour la toux ?

original: Are you able to buy a ticket after boarding the train?

original: It's hard to do.

original: You see that tall building over there, don't you?

original: I caught a glimpse of him in the crowd.

original: I can't decide which bicycle to buy.

original: There's a secret path on the left.

original: The princess was of so thoughtful and moody a turn of mind that no one could make her laugh; and the king had made known to all the world, that whoever could make her laugh should have her for his wife.
translated: La princesse était d'une tournure d'esprit tellement réfléchie et morose que personne ne pouvait la faire rire ; et le roi avait fait savoir à tout le monde que quiconque parvenait à la faire rire devrait l'avoir pour épouse.

original: You will never beat me, you hear? Never!

original: It is said that the old chapel is haunted.

original: Were you busy?

original: I made a stupid mistake.

original: He's a friend of my brother's.

original: The new tax law is full of loopholes.

original: We lost no time in sending him to the hospital.

original: I hate milk.

original: Thanks! I'll see you soon!

original: You need to be careful.

original: That's quite a story.

original: Are you looking?

original: I wouldn't have worried about that.

original: That's what I want most in the world.

original: Thank you for your efforts.

original: I belong here.

original: These oranges have gone bad.

original: I'd like to know when you plan to give me back the scissors I lent you.

original: Before the fire engine arrived, the whole house was burnt down.

original: Roses smell good.

original: You deserve a medal.

original: Tom has gone mute.

original: He sent you a book.

original: I know that you're smart.

original: Tom is now the spokesman for environmental groups.

original: This ring is very expensive.

original: In spite of all the cooking shows I've watched, I'm still no good in the kitchen.

original: What? That's what she called me?

original: Their teacher praised them.

original: "Quack, quack," said the duck.

original: He erased his speech from the tape.

original: We've got a situation here, you know.

original: They clustered around the fire.

original: They are no longer here.

original: I felt uncomfortable.

original: I have a job interview this morning.

original: I have won.

original: The cause of the fire is yet unknown.

original: He looked to the right and to the left.

original: Here's why I'm participating.

original: What Tom said was a lie.

original: He loved her.

original: I should've married your sister instead of you.

original: I had a revelation.

original: He is a warm-hearted man.

original: I don't know how we did it.

original: I found this under your bed.

original: Baa!

original: I'm as shocked as you are.

original: She needs our help.

original: Why are you doing this, Tom, why?

original: "Why do you take this medicine?" "To sleep."

original: Is it a boy or a girl?

original: Happy are those who know the value of health.

original: There are things that cannot be left to chance.

original: I can't distinguish him from his brother.

original: The day is almost over.

original: Have you seen my car keys?

original: It is obvious that he is right.

original: Mary is following me.

original: Tom is making breakfast.

original: Do you have a cellphone?

original: How lucky you are!

original: Tom was salivating.

original: I need ice.

original: I wonder if anybody knows how to do this.

original: Who did you go there with?

original: I think it's going to rain.

translated: Je suis habituée aux basses températures.

original: I've always loved Christmas.
translated: J'ai toujours aimé Noël.

original: There are no mistakes in your essay.
translated: Il n’y a pas de faute dans ta rédaction.

original: Our school is found in this village.
translated: Notre école se trouve dans ce village.

original: Take care of yourself, OK?
translated: Prenez soin de vous, d'accord ?

original: I've just seen the results.
translated: Je viens de voir les résultats.

original: We were mistaken.
translated: Nous nous trompions.

original: He died before I arrived.
translated: Il mourut avant que j'arrive.

original: Run and hide in the mountains.
translated: Cours et cache-toi dans les montagnes.

original: I was quite shocked by this.
translated: Je fus tout à fait choquée par cela.

original: I'm from Brazil.
translated: Je viens du Brésil.

original: We walked a lot.
translated: Nous avons beaucoup marché.

original: Mary said to Tom: "You're barmy!"
translated: Marie a dit à Tom : « Tu es dingue ! »

original: Are they cops?
translated: C'est des flics ?

original: The salts and minerals found in these mountains are quite diverse.
translated: Les sels et les minéraux qu'on peut trouver dans cette montagne sont très divers.

original: In judging his work, we must take his lack of experience into account.
translated: En jugeant son travail, nous devons prendre en compte son manque d'expérience.

original: She must have told a lie.
translated: Elle doit avoir dit un mensonge.

original: Tom squinted.
translated: Tom a plissé les yeux.

original: Does Tom have many friends?
translated: Tom a-t-il beaucoup d'amis ?

original: Tom and Mary bought John a bicycle for Christmas.
translated: Tom et Marie ont acheté un vélo à John pour Noël.

original: I'm sorry, I didn't understand what they said.
translated: Désolé, je n'ai pas compris ce qu'ils ont dit.

original: I suspected that something like this might happen.
translated: J'ai soupçonné qu'une telle chose pouvait arriver.

original: He's always complaining about the food.
translated: Il se plaint toujours de la nourriture.

original: Tom is very independent-minded.
translated: Tom est très indépendant.

original: I went to the scene of the crime.
translated: Je me rendis sur le lieu du crime.

original: Dig a deep hole.
translated: Creuse un trou profond.

original: Why would you want to do something like that?
translated: Pourquoi voudrais-tu faire une chose pareille ?

original: It takes Tom an hour to drive to work each day.
translated: Tom a besoin d'une heure par jour pour se rendre au travail.

original: Jump on the creature to kill it.
translated: Saute sur la créature pour la tuer.

original: I figured that might be the case.
translated: J'ai songé que ça pouvait être le cas.

original: I still have things left to do.
translated: Il me reste encore des choses à faire.

original: I've just found her.
translated: Je viens de la trouver.

original: Thank you for your prompt reply.
translated: Merci pour votre réponse rapide.

original: She hasn't slept all night.
translated: Elle n'a pas dormi de la nuit.

original: The phone belongs to you?
translated: Le téléphone portable vous appartient ?

original: Cookie needs a walk.
translated: Médor a besoin d'une promenade !

original: He did a real snow job on my daughter.
translated: Il a réussi à faire croire à ma fille que son histoire était plausible.

original: Don't use too much glue.
translated: N'utilise pas trop de colle.

original: She read the book all night.
translated: Elle a lu le livre toute la nuit.

original: Tom didn't know why Mary needed to borrow thirty dollars.
translated: Tom ne savait pas pourquoi Marie avait besoin d'emprunter trente dollars.

original: This paper doesn't absorb ink.
translated: Ce papier n'absorbe pas l'encre.

original: Why don't you let us go with you?
translated: Pourquoi ne nous laissez-vous pas y aller avec vous ?

original: You'll be free.
translated: Tu seras libre.

original: Do you want a slice of toast?
translated: Voulez-vous une tranche de pain grillé ?

original: It is better to die honorably than to live in disgrace.
translated: Il est préférable de mourir dans la gloire que de vivre dans le déshonneur.

original: That book is worth reading.
translated: Ce livre vaut la peine d'être lu.

original: I think you deserve more than this.
translated: Je pense que tu mérites davantage que ça.

original: I've been riding so long I'm starting to smell like my horse.
translated: Je monte depuis tellement de temps que je commence à sentir comme mon cheval.

original: Park across from the hotel.
translated: Garez-vous en face de l'hôtel.

original: She looked at me and laughed.
translated: Elle me regarda et rit.

original: You should carry out your first plan.
translated: Il faudrait que tu ailles jusqu'au bout de ton premier plan.

original: My placement supervisor allowed me to take a day off.
translated: Mon maître de stage m'a laissé prendre un jour de congé.

original: How are things for you up there?
translated: Comment va tout là-haut ?

original: He fell into a deep sleep.
translated: Il est tombé dans un profond sommeil.

original: He rocks.
translated: Il assure.

original: He is almost done filling out the form.
translated: Il a presque fini de remplir le formulaire.

original: It's a matter of the utmost importance.
translated: C'est une question de la plus haute importance.

original: Handsome women age far better than pretty women.
translated: Les belles femmes vieillissent bien mieux que celles qui sont mignonnes.

original: Do it as soon as possible.
translated: Fais-le dès que possible.

original: The last dart he threw, bounced off the board.
translated: La dernière fléchette qu'il a lancée a rebondi sur la cible.

original: I get off here.
translated: Je descends ici.

original: The sheets were soaked with sweat.
translated: Les draps étaient trempés de sueur.

original: That's a lie.
translated: Il s'agit d'un mensonge.

original: I can't answer that yet.
translated: Je ne peux pas encore répondre à cela.

original: Did you see anyone on the beach?
translated: Avez-vous vu qui que ce soit sur la plage ?

original: Does that mean you won't come?
translated: Est-ce que ça veut dire que vous n'allez pas venir ?

original: I'm a bit of a reader myself.
translated: Je suis moi-même un peu lecteur.

original: In spite of the bad weather, they decided to go by car.
translated: Malgré le mauvais temps, ils ont décidé d'y aller en voiture.

original: Would you move your car, please?
translated: Pourriez-vous déplacer votre voiture, s'il vous plaît ?

original: I'm very proud of my daughter.
translated: Je suis très fier de ma fille.

original: The dog must stay outside!
translated: Le chien doit rester dehors !

original: Tom visited Boston last month.
translated: Tom a visité Boston le mois dernier.

original: Speak slowly, please.
translated: Parlez lentement, je vous prie.

original: I have an alibi.
translated: J'ai un alibi.

original: Peel the carrots and slice them into strips.
translated: Pelez les carottes et coupez-les en bâtonnets.

original: We need answers.
translated: Il nous faut des réponses.

original: This is a very, very rare problem.
translated: Il s'agit là d'un problème rarissime.

original: I wish you the best of luck.
translated: Je te souhaite beaucoup de chance.

original: Tom just laughed.
translated: Tom s'est contenté de rire.

original: We talked about various topics.
translated: Nous parlâmes de divers sujets.
